text: United States gubernatorial elections were held in 1939, in three states. Kentucky, Louisiana and Mississippi hold their gubernatorial elections in odd numbered years, every 4 years, preceding the United States presidential election year. == Results == {| class="wikitable" |- ! State !! Incumbent !! Party !! Status !! Opposing Candidates |- | Kentucky || Keen Johnson || Democratic || Re-elected, 56.51% || King Swope (Republican) 43.49% |- | Louisiana (Held, 16 April 1940) || Earl Long || Democratic || Defeated in Democratic primary, Democratic victory || Sam H. Jones (Democratic) 99.40% W. W. Tuttle (Republican) 0.60% _(Democratic primary run-off results)_ Sam H. Jones 51.73% Earl Long 48.27% |- | Mississippi ||bgcolor="lightgrey"| Hugh L. White || Democratic || Term- limited, Democratic victory || Paul B. Johnson Sr. (Democratic) 100.00% _(Democratic primary run-off results)_ Paul B. Johnson Sr. 54.66% Martin Sennet Conner 45.34% |} ==References== Gubernatorial Category:November 1939 events
title: 1939 United States gubernatorial elections
